discussion.content: HSM (hardware security module) is also a crypto-processor that can be used to enhance security. HSM is commonly used with PKI systems to augment security with CAs.

HSM) is a physical computing device that safeguards and manages digital keys, performs encryption and decryption functions for digital signatures, strong authentication and other cryptographic functions.

questions.question_text: A Chief Information Officer (CIO) is concerned that encryption keys might be exfiltrated by a contractor. The CIO wants to keep control over key visibility and management. Which of the following would be the BEST solution for the CIO to implement?`

A company recently implemented a new security system. In the course of configuration, the security administrator adds the following entry:
#Whitelist

USB\VID_13FE&PID_4127&REV_0100 -
Which of the following security technologies is MOST likely being configured?

comments.content: PID is device ID, or Process ID ?

discussion.content:
Answer is correct.
VID- VERSION ID, PID- DEVICE ID, REV- REVOLUTIONS PER MINUTE
USB\VID_13FE&PID_4127&REV_0100 - the whitelist refers to USB as stated in the command.
But you still have USB written too

comments.content: When you see WHITELIST, think of explicitly ALLOWEDLIST, that comes with an implicit DENY to any and everything that don't make the LIST! This is the opposite of a BLACKLIST, which Explicitly DENYs things on list with an implicit ALLOW for all thing not on list...you can WHITELIST all manner of things, and here they are allowing only 1 specific type of USB stick! But you can WHITELIST Applications, IP and MAC addresses...even people, say like with wedding invitations or Club events! This is a racist term, full of privilege and implicit biases lol lol!!! Soon will be BANNED and you will have to learn new words and risk being fired... AMEN/AWOMAN lol lol lol

discussion.content: it not removable it's a whitelist !!!

comments.content: I read the question multiple times but only now I managed to see the top text saying: #Whitelist
they are whitelisting REMOVABLE MEDIA not applications. Given answer is correct
The given answer is correct B AND C

discussion.content: NC = Netcat? What a pile of cr@p

Tcdump is a command line protocol analyzer Nmap is a sophisticated network scanner that runs from the commannd line. Net cat can be used to remotely administer system and also gather info on remote system . Nc is netcat command. Tracert command list the routers between system.

questions.question_text: A penetration tester is checking to see if an internal system is vulnerable to an attack using a remote listener. Which of the following commands should the penetration tester use to verify if this vulnerability exists? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
-- Improper Input Handling attack
When an attacker tries to exploit improper input handling, the result might simply be
to crash the process hosting the code or even the OS (performing Denial of Service).
The attacker may be able to use the exploit to obtain sufficient privileges to run
whatever malware (or arbitrary code) he or she chooses. A successful exploit can
also facilitate data exfiltration from applications, databases, and operating systems if it
allows the adversary to obtain privileges over the data that they would not normally
have.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST likely caused by improper input handling?

comments.content: And also the output is patently key stroke inputs

discussion.content:
keyword here is the "Temp" file path. 
A keylogger attempts to capture a user’s keystrokes. The keystrokes are
stored in a file, and are either sent to an attacker automatically, or the
attacker may manually retrieve the file.
Keylogger is the tool used not the "cause" as they ask but anyway.

comments.content: Its the cause. Without keylogger you wont get the output

questions.question_text:
A security administrator is investigating a possible account compromise. The administrator logs onto a desktop computer, executes the command notepad.exe c:
\Temp\qkakforlkgfkja.1og, and reviews the following:
Lee,\rI have completed the task that was assigned to me\rrespectfully\rJohn\r https://www.portal.com\rjohnuser\rilovemycat2
Given the above output, which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this compromise?
